bibl.title: Letter from Luis B. Pogolotti to Philip Showalter Hench, May 14, 1940

div1.p: Pogolotti refers to photographs seen in Cuba and forwarded through Moran. He seeks medical advice on asthma.

div1.head: Letter from Luis B. Pogolotti to Philip Showalter Hench, May 14, 1940
div1.opener:
Marianao, May 14th, 1940
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic, U. S. A.
Dear Dr. Hench,
div1.p:
I don't expect to hear from
you as yet as I know you were going
to be busy for about 6 weeks-

I am anxious to see the
pictures I marked with a “P” in
the back of the copies you showed
me at the dock.

I gave Mr. Moran the copies
of “Pogolotti” (modern) and of the
old one full of staines due to
“age” and climate, and I suppose
he sent them to you already.

As it will probably never happen
again that I should get in direct
friendship with a member of the
wonderful “Mayo” organisation, I
take the liberty to ask you if
some Doctor friends of yours spe-
cialist in = ashma = has some
bulletin, or any information on
the subject (bronquial troubles) not
so technical.

I have been suffering
for ashma for quite a number
of years, and had the first
Ac
CL
touch when I was at
Tulane University of
Louisiana, accompanied
by violent sneezing and
ru nose running - (in 1909)

I thank you anyway
for the trouble and hope
it does not mean more
work for you.

With my best regards
to Mrs. Hench I remain
